Secret Sharing Capstone¶

ThresTree¶

class ThresTree.ThresTree[source]¶

Tree designed to be used with Adi Shamir’s (n, k)-thresholding scheme.

root¶

TreeNode – The root node of the tree.

addChild(addr)[source]¶

Add a child node to a node at a given address.

Parameters:addr (String) – Address of node that new node is being added to with the format ‘#:#:#:…’.
propagate(data=None)[source]¶

Propogates the tree with data. If none is given a DSA key-pair will be generated by the Voter class.

Parameters:data (int) – The data to be propogated down the tree. (Usually None)
removeChild(addr)[source]¶

Removes a child node of a node at a given address. Removes a random child node.

Parameters:addr (String) – Address of node that node is being removed from with the format ‘#:#:#:…’.
search(name)[source]¶

Searches for a node at a given address.

Parameters:name (String) – Address of node with the format ‘#:#:#:…’.
Returns:A node with the corresponding address.
Return type:TreeNode
class ThresTree.TreeNode(addr, parent=None)[source]¶

Nodes used by the Tree object

addr¶

String – Address of this node.

parent¶

TreeNode – Parent node.

documents¶

list – Documents list.

voter¶

Voter – Voter object.

finalized¶

boolean – Keeps track of whether this node has been finalized.

current_vote¶

String, String – The documents that is currently being voted on.

already_voted¶

list – List of node address that have already voted.

Note

already_voted variable is only used if this node has child nodes.

finalize(data=None)[source]¶

Creates a voter object for each non-leaf node and sets key data for each leaf.

Parameters:data (int, int) – key data from parent nodes
Returns:True if the signature is correct, False otherwise.
Return type:boolean
show_documents(verified_only=False)[source]¶

Displays all of the documents for root.

Parameters:verified_only (boolean) – Flag to only print verified/signed documents

Todo

Implement this for all levels of ducument sets. e.g. print documents for address 0:2. Requires implementing DSA signing on all levels.

split(n, k)[source]¶

Split a node from being a leaf to having children.

Parameters:
  • n (int) – The number of key to generate for this voter.
  • k (int) – The number of vote required to pass a vote.
vote(doc, key=None)[source]¶

Votes on a given document

Parameters:
  • doc (String, String) – The document being voted on. First element is the file name. Second is the document’s text.
  • key (int, int) – key data passed up from child nodes

Todo

Turn current_vote into a queue of documents waiting to be voted on.

Voter¶

class Voter.Voter(node, n, k, prime_size=1024)[source]¶
Voter implements a (n,k)-threshold scheme which is capable of submiting
a signature.
prime_size¶

int – Size of the prime number. (Default: 1024)

p¶

int – The prime number.

n¶

int – The number of keys to make with Shamir’s Scheme.

k¶

int – The number of keys required to construct the data.

values¶

list – The values for the active Asynchronous Neville’s Method.

pubKey¶

PubKey – Public Key object for DSA.

node¶

TreeNoe – The node this Voter belongs to.

Note

Digital Signature Specifications (DSS) specifies that the prime length should be 1024/2048 (Can’t Remember).

add_key_to_signature(key, doc)[source]¶

Function implements the Asynchronous Neville’s Method and adds the given key to the in progress vote.

Parameters:
  • key (int, int) – The key being added to the LIP.
  • doc – The document being voted on.

Todo

Ensure that the submitted key is actually valid. ie. It is from the set of keys originally generated for this voter.

Note

This function returns both a signature if there is one, and a boolean of whether or not a vote has finished.

generate_scheme(data=None)[source]¶

Generates the private-public key pair, the polynomial, and the keys for this voter.

Parameters:data – The data to be used as the secret data. (Note: None means the voter is for root node.)

Todo

Implement non-root DSA key pairs. This is to allow for signing of sub-root document sets. Problem consists of being given a private key and having to generate a public key.

sign(doc, private_key)[source]¶

Function creates the digital signature for a given document with this voter’s private key.

Parameters:doc – The document that is being signed.
Returns:A signature if this node has a public key, else None.
Return type:(int, int)

Todo

Right now the doc param is a string 2-tuple, this might be better as just a String since all that is needed is the document text and it would be more intuitive for future users.

verify(doc, signature)[source]¶

Function verifies a digital signature. for a given document with this voter’s public key.

Parameters:
  • doc (String) – The document that is being signed.
  • signature (int, int) – DSA signature being verified.
Returns:

True if the voter has a public key and the signature is correct, False otherwise.
Return type:

boolean

Toolkit.data_to_key(data, p)[source]¶

Calculates a congruent integer to the numerator that is divisible by the denominator.

Parameters:
  • data (int) –

    .

  • n (int) – The maximum number the first term in the key can be.
Returns:

key. The key pair from the given encoded integer.
Return type:

(int, int)
Toolkit.find_divisible_congruency(fraction, p)[source]¶

Calculates a congruent integer to the numerator that is divisible by the denominator.

Parameters:fraction (Fraction) – fraction, the fraction in question.
Returns:The z such that z = (num + i*prime)/den and z is an integer (without trunction).
Return type:int
Toolkit.generate_keys(poly, n, p)[source]¶

Creates the keys for distributing.

Parameters:
  • poly (Polynomial) – Polynomial function to create the keys.
  • n (int) –
  • p (int) – The prime modulus.
Returns:

list of key pairs generated by Shamir’s Scheme.
Return type:

list of int tuples
Toolkit.generate_polynomial(data, k, p)[source]¶

Makes a random polynomial with data as the coeficient term.

Parameters:
  • data (int) – The data as a numeric value to be split.
  • k (int) – The number of points required to interpolate the polynomial, which is the polynomial’s order plus one.
  • p (int) – The prime modulus.
Returns:

polynomial as a lambda function.
Return type:

Polynomial
Toolkit.key_to_data(key, n)[source]¶

Calculates a congruent integer to the numerator that is divisible by the denominator.

Parameters:
  • key (int, int) – The key pair to be encoded.
  • n (int) – The maximum number the first term in the key can be.
Returns:

data. The key pair encoded as an integer.
Return type:

int
Toolkit.next_multiple_of_128(data)[source]¶

Calculates the smallest number of bits bigger than the length of data and a multiple of 128.

Toolkit.nthOrderLag(values, n)[source]¶

Calculates the (n)th-ordered Lagrangian Interpolating Polynomial, evaluated at 0.

Parameters:n (int) – The order of the next LIP.
Returns:A fraction containing the value of the nth LIP, evaluated at 0.
Return type:Fraction
Toolkit.random_distinct(lower_bound, upper_bound, size)[source]¶

Generates lists of distinct random numbers,

Parameters:
  • lower_bound (int) – Low bound for searching.
  • upper_bound (int) – High bound for searching.
  • size (int) – Length of list of numbers.
Returns:

List of random numbers within given bounds.
Return type:

int
